results.title: Arthropods: millipedes, centipedes, crustaceans... (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Of the eight animal species that of the arthropoda is the largest and biologically most successful. Using microphotography the film briefly but clearly explains various functions and activities of some members of the species. An up-close and personal look at millipedes, centipedes, crustaceans, arachnids and insects.

results.title: The Jointed-legged animals: arthropods
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film shows the jointed-legged animals and the structural and functional characteristics of animals in the phylum arthropoda: examples from each of the five classes, and their evolutionary development. Metamorphosis and moulting processes are illustrated using photo-micrography and time-lapse photography. The economic importance to man is discussed. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Arthropods: insects and their relatives
results.brief_description: This film examines the major physical characteristics which are used to identify arthropods. It compares and studies examples from each of the four main classifications - myriapods, insects, arachnids and crustaceans - and describes their common characteristics, their environments, and the ways in which they are helpful and harmful. Uses magnified close-ups and detailed anatomical drawings. No other credits available.

results.brief_description: The joint-legged animals and the structural and functional characteristics of animals in the phylum Arthropoda; examples from each of the five classes, and their evolutionary development. Metamorphosis and moulting processes are illustrated using photomicrography and time-lapse photography. The economic importance of this class of animals is also discussed.

results.title: Crustacea from the gulf of Maine
results.brief_description: Balanus, Caprella, Crago, Hippolyte, Homarus, and Pagarus serve to illustrate various groups pf crustaceans found along the rocky coast of Maine. The picture opens with a colony of barnacles in action, followed by high magnifications of the cirri. Several specimens shed their integuments to allow for continual growth. Large individuals dredged from deep water are similarly shown. The skeleton shrimp shows its protective blending of form and colour with the algal background, and we see the peculiar structure of this obscure animal. The prawn and lobster reveal decapod structure and activity and demonstrate such features as the main divisions of the body, the mouth parts and the sensory and ecomotor appendages. The hermit crabs protect themselves by occupying the shells of various gastropod molluscs, and one individual deprived of its shell is seem to enter a new one in time to avoid capture of another hermit crab.

results.title: The Artful dodger
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
There is an artful dodger in every crowd and on every road. Demonstrates the driving style of such a person - the dodging in and out of traffic at high speed which is dangerous and can cause frayed nerves and accidents. The dodger is the person who takes unnecessary risks for no apparent reason - he is not a good safe driver. No other credits available.

results.title: Artfest: where do we go from here
results.creator_credit: Gary Kildea, Esau Reuben and Papua New Guinea. Office of Information
results.brief_description: A film which looks at the determination, of the people of Papua New Guinea, to preserve their different cultures. Lifestyles have drastically changed with many people now living in the towns and leaving their village customs behind. This film concentrates on an arts festival which aimed to present traditional ideas and also to incorporate new ones.

results.title: The Art teacher has nine kittens
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A basket of kittens serves as a vehicle for experiences in classifying, counting, and colour recognition, and extends an understanding of the birth and care of young animals for a kindergarten class.

results.title: Art survives the times
results.brief_description: A record of art life in France. Leading artists such as Matisse, Picasso, Ultrillo and the sculptors, Roualt, Laurens and Janniot, are shown at work. The architects, Le Corbusier and Perret, also display plans for homes and cities. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of the real: U.S.A. 1948 to 1968
results.brief_description: The film is about an exhibit called the “Art of the Real” at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. It illustrates the Americans great concern for their culture and that the culture is real and moving, and sometimes controversial. It employs a variety of techniques including double exposures, vignettes, slow motion, freezes, camera movements, moving lights, etc.
